column4: I have kvm and kvm_amd in /etc/modules but they are not loaded at boot time, but will modprobe.  How do I get them to load at boot?
works for me... can you post the modules file and the dmesg ?
yes, did not think of dmesg
brain damage on the dmeg, working onit.
much noise here, in case you missed it:  http://pastebin.org/89001  http://pastebin.org/89000
weird i have a amd 3800+ and have no problems at all
yes it is.  I can cludge it by a start up script that runs modprobe, but I don't remember how to do that.
i only load kvm-amd from modules though (and is with - not with _ )
I know that kvm-_intel or amd *will* load kvm
